17. Read the passage below and answer the questions that follow.
Tiba and Afya are friends. Both are Form One students at Litenga Secondary School. Tiba does not have many friends at school. He is usually with Afya. He does not talk much and most of the time he criticises his classmates for being unfair to him. Apart from that, Tiba often refuses to discuss academic issues with him. He complains that his fellow students do not like him. Yesterday, Mr Azidieli, the class teacher, asked Tiba why he always appears untidy. He doesn’t comb his hair, brush his teeth or wash his clothes properly.
Questions

(b) Mention the effect of Tiba’s behaviour on his academic performance.
(c) Suggest three ways in which Tiba could deal with his problem.
